variants.HGVS: N.D. (API standardization not possible without more details. From literature it seems to be related to a missense mutation in a - syn gene, likely in cDNA leading to A53T change in protein. But exact HGVS not given)

Described Disease.Described Disease: Parkinson's disease (PD), specifically familial PD with A53T a - syn mutation
Described Disease.MONDO: MONDO:0007673 (Retrieved from MONDO database for Parkinson's disease)

Material used.Material Name: Brain tissue from patient IX - 51 of the Contursi kindred
Material used.Description: The patient (IX - 51) of the Contursi kindred, at autopsy, left half of the brain including brainstem was fixed in formalin and right half was frozen. Blocks of tissue from selected areas of the left hemisphere were used for immunohistochemistry.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (presence of insoluble filamentous a - syn lesions and tau pathology)
Readout description.Result Description: Insoluble filamentous a - syn lesions were detected in almost all brain regions. Accumulation of insoluble nitrated a - syn was observed. Significant accumulations of filamentous insoluble tau protein were detected in some brain regions. Large spheroids were notable in certain regions, and spongiform change was noted in several cortical regions. Some spheroids showed tau immunoreactivity, and neuritic pathology was typically positive for either tau or a - syn but not both.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of insoluble a - syn and tau lesions (Custom, based on the knowledge that in normal conditions these abnormal protein aggregations are not present)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of insoluble a - syn and tau lesions (Custom, based on the knowledge that these are hallmarks of the disease)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Immunohistochemistry is a commonly used method to study protein localization and pathology in PD)

Material used.Material Name: Frozen brain tissue from cingulate cortex, midfrontal cortex, cerebellum, hippocampus and 10 different subcortical areas of patient IX - 51
Material used.Description: One - gram samples of frozen brain tissue from some regions and 0.15 g samples from subcortical areas were fractionated based on differential extractability using buffered solutions of increasing solubilization strengths.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (protein levels analyzed by SDS - PAGE and Western blotting)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (altered solubility of a - syn and presence of nitrated a - syn and insoluble tau)
Readout description.Result Description: A significant portion of a - syn in cingulate cortex from case IX - 51 was extractable only with SDS or FA. Insoluble a - syn was widespread in many brain regions. Nitrated a - syn was present in hippocampus and cingulate cortex. Significant levels of insoluble tau were detected in several brain regions, and the tau isoform profile was similar to that of insoluble hyperphosphorylated filamentous tau in AD and other tauopathies.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal levels of soluble a - syn and absence of nitrated a - syn and insoluble tau (Custom, based on the knowledge of normal protein status)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Altered levels of soluble a - syn, presence of nitrated a - syn and insoluble tau (Custom, based on the knowledge of disease - associated protein changes)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Biochemical fractionation and Western blotting are standard methods for studying protein solubility and modification in PD)

Material used.Material Name: Insoluble tau from the hippocampus and dorsal pons of patient IX - 51
Material used.Description: Insoluble tau from the hippocampus and dorsal pons was dephosphorylated with Escherichia coli alkaline phosphatase for analysis.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (isoform composition similar to AD and distinct from other tauopathies)
Readout description.Result Description: The insoluble tau isolated from this case was composed of both three - repeat and four - repeat tau isoforms, similar to AD and distinct from other tauopathies such as PSP and CBD.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal tau isoform composition (Custom, based on the knowledge of normal tau isoforms in non - diseased state)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Abnormal tau isoform composition as seen in AD - like pattern (Custom, based on the knowledge of disease - associated tau isoform changes)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Analysis of tau isoform composition is a relevant method for studying tauopathies associated with PD)

Material used.Material Name: Selected brain sections from patient IX - 51
Material used.Description: Selected brain sections were used for immunoelectron microscopy (EM) studies.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (presence of characteristic spheroids with filamentous ultrastructure for a - syn and tau fibrils)
Readout description.Result Description: Immuno - EM studies of inclusions labeled with antibodies to a - syn revealed characteristic spheroids with filamentous ultrastructure. Inclusions containing tau fibrils were also detected. Isolated sarkosyl - insoluble material from hippocampus and dorsal pons contained a - syn and tau filaments similar to those in other neurodegenerative diseases.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of abnormal filamentous structures (Custom, based on the knowledge of normal brain ultrastructure)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of abnormal filamentous structures characteristic of a - syn and tau fibrils (Custom, based on the knowledge of disease - associated ultrastructural changes)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Ultrastructural analysis by EM is a standard method for studying protein aggregates in neurodegenerative diseases)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Isolation of dispersed a - syn and tau filaments

Material used.Material Name: Hippocampus (for a - syn) and dorsal pons (for tau) of patient IX - 51
Material used.Description: Tissue from hippocampus and dorsal pons was homogenized and processed to isolate dispersed a - syn and tau filaments.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (presence of a - syn and tau filaments)
Readout description.Result Description: Filaments extracted from hippocampus and dorsal pons were immunolabeled and visualized by EM, showing the presence of a - syn and tau filaments.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of a - syn and tau filaments (Custom, based on the knowledge of normal brain filament status)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of a - syn and tau filaments (Custom, based on the knowledge of disease - associated filament formation)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Isolation and visualization of filaments is a relevant method for studying protein aggregation in PD)

Material used.Material Name: Bacterial recombinant tau T40, recombinant wild - type (WT) and A53T mutant a - syn
Material used.Description: These recombinant proteins were used for in vitro fibril formation assays.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (quantification of fibrils using K114 binding and sedimentation analysis)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (enhanced fibrillization for A53T mutant a - syn compared to WT a - syn)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Enhanced fibrillization (both self - assembly of a - syn and promotion of tau fibrillization)
Readout description.Result Description: Fibril assembly was much faster for A53T compared to WT a - syn. Co - assembly experiments showed that the rates of assembly of a - syn and tau were accelerated when A53T instead of WT a - syn was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal rate of fibrillization for WT a - syn and tau (Custom, based on the knowledge of normal protein fibrillization rate)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Enhanced rate of fibrillization as seen with A53T mutant a - syn (Custom, based
